reviewText: Really just bought it for the "He died with a falafel in his hand,"great movie. Not sure about the others.
For those who enjoy this genre it is well worth the purchase

The best dark comedy film is "He Died With A Falafel In His Hand" from Australia, directed by Richard Lowenstein. This is a smart, stylish and sexy film. I give it five stars. If you liked the early films (Trainspotting and Shallow Grave) by Irish director Danny Boyle, I think you will like this one.
For second place I like the Canadian film "Falling Angels", which is about an incredibly dysfunctional family. I give it two stars.
For third place I have a tie: "Aaltra" from Finland, which takes place in France and Belgium, and "Adam's Apples" from Denmark, which is about God vs. Satan. I give each one 1 star.
